name: Dashboard Navigation — Dedicated Screens
description: Move Projects, Tools, Meetings, Spreadsheets, Docs, and Team from sections on a single scrolling page to their own dedicated screens/routes. Each section becomes a first-class page with its own URL, improving navigation and reducing the single-page scroll depth.

tasks.name: Thomas
tasks.summary: Wrote requirements doc: 4 new dedicated pages (projects, tools, meetings, team), index becomes hub page, nav updates, acceptance criteria
decisions: Meetings, Projects, Tools, Team get dedicated pages; Docs and Spreadsheets already done
Separate HTML files (not client-side routing) following existing spreadsheets.html/docs.html pattern
index.html becomes hub with hero + nav cards + How It Works; all section content and JS removed
How It Works removed from nav (stays on landing page as secondary content)
styles.css loaded on all pages for v1; CSS splitting deferred to future improvement

tasks.name: Andrei
tasks.summary: Wrote tech approach: copy-paste nav per page, extract sections to 4 new HTML files, hub card grid on index.html, no backend changes, no new dependencies
decisions: Copy-paste nav across all pages (proven pattern, acceptable for 7 files)
Standardize docs.html active link from <span> to <a> with aria-current for consistency
AG Grid CSS/JS only loaded on docs.html and spreadsheets.html (removed from index.html after split)
Hub card grid uses CSS Grid with auto-fill minmax(280px, 1fr), styles added to existing styles.css
No CSS splitting — all section pages load full styles.css (file is small, R4 explicitly defers this)
All JS modules already have null guards — no changes needed for safety on wrong-page loads

tasks.name: Robert
tasks.summary: Wrote design spec: hub card grid mirrors tool-card pattern (border, padding, radius, hover), 6 cards with name+desc (no icons, no counts), dedicated pages use existing section-title and container patterns, nav active state with aria-current, no page transitions for v1
decisions: Hub cards follow tool-card visual pattern exactly (border, radius, padding, hover border-color)
No icons or item counts on hub cards — keeps index.html fully static with zero JS
Explicit breakpoints (2-col at 640px, 3-col at 1024px) instead of auto-fill to match tools grid behavior
No back-to-hub affordance needed — logo already links home per web convention
Dedicated pages keep <h2> with .section-title (same HTML as extracted sections, no semantic change)
No page transitions for v1 — standard browser navigation

tasks.name: Alice
tasks.summary: Created 5 new dedicated pages (tools.html, projects.html, meetings.html, interviews.html, team.html), transformed index.html into hub page with nav card grid, updated nav on all 7 pages (including docs.html and spreadsheets.html), added hub CSS to styles.css, split interviews from meetings into its own page
decisions: Interviews is a separate page from meetings — interview button, config panel, and active panel live on interviews.html only
Meetings page excludes interview button from toolbar — only charter, weekly, and custom meeting buttons
audio-worklet-processor.js loaded programmatically by gemini-client.js via AudioWorklet.addModule(), no script tag needed
Cross-module CustomEvents between interview.js and meetings.js are harmless on separate pages — listeners simply never fire
docs.html active link changed from <span> to <a> with aria-current='page' for consistency
index.html has zero JS — fully static hub page with hero, 7 nav cards, and How It Works
AG Grid CSS/JS removed from index.html (only needed on docs.html and spreadsheets.html)
